result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaylee L. Rooney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall submit to drug testing.
Defendant shall attend current educational programming without any unexcused truancy.
Expungement granted under 973.015 after successful completion of probation without any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaylee L. Rooney

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shaylee L. Rooney in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Shaylee L. Rooney. Per agreement, state moves to amend Ct 1 to misdemeanor Possession of THC, 961.41(3g)(e).  State recommends 1 year probation with the following conditions: pay court costs, go to school with no unexcused truancy, drug testing, counseling, and DNA. State does not oppose to expungement. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Court grants amendment to Ct 1. Defendant pleads guilty to amended Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of amended Ct 1. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 1 year of probation. Conditions of probation are to pay court costs, DNA, submit to random drug testing, attend current educational program without any unexcused truancy, and expungement.

Defendant Shaylee L. Rooney appeared in court, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt for Shaylee L. Rooney appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Matthew Small sworn and testified. Cross. Comments heard. Court heard and finds probable cause to bind over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

DEFENDANT SHALL CONTACT PUBLIC DEFENDER'S OFFICE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE BY CALLING 608-401-2030.
DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH CODY KITSEMBLE.
DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH C.K.

Defendant Shaylee L. Rooney appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State request signature bond with no contact with victims. Defendant heard. Court orders $1000 signature bond with no contact provisions and to contact SPD. Status as to counsel set.
Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
